html.p: Definitions. Given a linear transformation [mathjaxinline]T: V\rightarrow W[/mathjaxinline], the nullity of [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] is the dimension of the kernel of [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline], and the rank of [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] is the dimension of the image of [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline].

If a matrix [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] is the standard matrix for a linear transformation [mathjaxinline]T:\mathbb R^ n \rightarrow \mathbb R^ m[/mathjaxinline], then the rank and nullity of [mathjaxinline]A[/mathjaxinline] are the same as the rank and nullity of [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline].
